journey.1.text: However, you succumb to your thirst.

journey.4.text: However, You succumb to your hunger.

journey.18.label: Rest here, drink your fill, and refill your bottles.

journey.18.3.2.text: drinking your fill from the stream

journey.25.label: Eat a meal of smoked venison.

journey.25.2.text: at a meal of smoked venison.

fishing.1.text: You spread out your hooks and line and settle in for a bit of fishing.

fishing.4.text: While your line bobs, you take a spare moment to quench your thirst from the running water.

done.fishing.1.1.text: A fish wanders by and tentatively nibbles your line.

done.fishing.1.2.text: You feel a nibble on your line.

done.fishing.1.3.text: Out of the blue, you feel a tug and your rod dips toward the water.

done.fishing.2.1.2.text: on line and drag the fish

done.fishing.2.2.text: The fish drags your line and you pull

done.fishing.8.1.text: Time passes but no fish have bitten.

done.fishing.8.2.text: You may have felt a nibble, but the time is lost.

done.fishing.8.3.text: The fish seem shy this hour.

done.fishing.8.4.text: After a while, a fish wallows by your hook but pays it no heed.

done.fishing.15.1.text: You pack up and return to the trail.

done.fishing.16.1.text: You bait your hook with a worm and toss it out again.

done.fishing.16.2.text: You try a fresh worm you find in the loam.

done.fishing.16.3.text: You cast your line off once

forest.2.1.text: You find yourself in a copse of

forest.2.2.text: You find yourself among the trunks of

forest.3.1.text: A gentle breeze brings the smell of a rich

forest.3.2.text: Your passing raises a light dust.

forest.3.3.text: A squirrel scrambles up and around a nearby tree.

forest.3.4.text: A squirrel chirps from a distant branch.

forest.3.6.text: Nothing stirs and the wood keeps its secrets.

forest.4.1.text: A broken stump stands beside the path.

forest.4.2.text: The path passes between two noble trunks.

forest.4.3.text: A blackened trunk stands beside the path.

forest.4.5.0.1.text: You hear burrowing from a thicket beside the road.

forest.4.5.0.3.text: A nearby thicket appears to be the home of some burrowing creature.

clearing.2.1.text: You find yourself in a clearing.

clearing.2.3.text: The trees clear around you, revealing the sky above.

clearing.3.1.text: Green grass bows to the wind.

clearing.3.2.text: Amber grasses dance in the breeze.

clearing.3.3.text: A sheet of gray shale tilts out of the earth.

clearing.3.4.text: The lands all around are pocked with boulders.

clearing.3.5.text: A shallow gorge hosts a dry creek bed running along the way.

clearing.7.2.text: A marmot squeaks on a distant rock.

river.2.1.text: A river with fresh water flows through here.

river.2.2.text: A wide stream flows across the way.

river.2.3.text: Waters flow down from the hills to the north, over the trail here.

river.2.4.text: A small creek flows from a narrow culvert, over the trail.

river.2.5.text: A stout bridge carries the road over a narrow channel of water.

river.2.6.text: Stepping stones wade in a shallow stream, guiding your track over the water.

river.2.7.text: A cascade of deep, cold pools fall from the hillside to the north and spill through myriad channels through the trail.

river.3.1.text: The trickle of water is music to your ears.

river.3.2.text: The promise of refreshment puts your heart and feet at ease.

river.3.3.text: The damp reaches your nose and cools your skin.

inventory.4.1.0.1.0.1.text: no food nor water to spare.

time.1.1.text: high don, the hour of the rowan

time.1.2.text: elm hour, the hour after high don

time.1.3.text: fir hour, the hour before high non

time.1.4.text: high non, with the sun directly overhead

time.1.5.text: cedar hour, the hour after high non

time.1.6.text: holly hour, the hour before high dusk

time.1.7.text: high dusk, the hour of the hawthorne

time.1.8.text: low dusk, the hour of the alder

time.1.9.text: ash hour, the hour after low dusk

time.1.10.text: oak hour, the hour before low non

time.1.11.text: low non, the hour of the elder and the middle of the night

time.1.12.text: birch hour, the hour after low non

time.1.13.text: yew hour, the hour before low don

time.1.14.text: low don, the hour of the willow

hunger.1.7.text: have missed more meals than you care to remember

hunger.1.9.text: are likely to die of your hunger soon

fin.5.text: league marker serves passes for your tomb stone.

fin.9.text: leagues. May they rest in peace.”
